bug.author: leemgs
bug.summary: [Example] Need to add exception handling for incorrect env setting.
bug.description:
The users frequently forget a condition that they have to set environment setting for NNStreamer applications. So we need to add exception handling for incorrect env setting. Please, append the check routine if environment setting is normally declared. <denchmark-code>$ export NNST_ROOT=$HOME/nnstreamer # set your own path to install libs and header files $ export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:$NNST_ROOT/lib $ export GST_PLUGIN_PATH=$GST_PLUGIN_PATH:$NNST_ROOT/lib </denchmark-code>
Case study - runtime error in case of incorrect env setting:
invain@mymate:~/nnstreamer/bin$ ./nnstreamer_example_filter ** Message: start app.. ** Message: finished to load labels, total 1001
(nnstreamer_example_filter:26620): GLib-GObject-WARNING **: invalid (NULL) pointer instance
(nnstreamer_example_filter:26620): GLib-GObject-CRITICAL **: g_signal_connect_data: assertion 'G_TYPE_CHECK_INSTANCE (instance)' failed
(nnstreamer_example_filter:26620): GStreamer-CRITICAL **: gst_object_unref: assertion 'object != NULL' failed ** Message: app failed! [line : 469] ** Message: close app..

comments.comment: : Thank you for posting issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/issues/554>#554</denchmark-link> . The person in charge will reply soon.
